channel.title: design-patterns on Software engineering notes
channel.description: Recent content in design-patterns on Software engineering notes

item.title: Design Patterns
item.description: SOLID Principles Single Responsibility Principle Each class should have only one responsibility or reason to change. narrow down the behaviour a class can have Open-Closed Principle Software entities should be open for extension but closed for modification. to add new functionality to a class without changing the existing code by extending a class and adding new functions into subclass Liskov Substitution Principle Objects of a superclass should be replaceable with objects of a subclass without affecting the correctness of the program.
